Duilia Fernandes de Mello

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/1224579699448110
  • Última atualização do currículo em 19/04/2016

Possui doutorado em Astronomia pela Universidade de São Paulo (1995). É professora associada da Universidade Católica da América (tenured) e Pesquisadora associada (Science Collaborator) do Goddard Space Flight Center. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2012 - 2014
The Panchromatic Hubble Ultra Deep Field: Ultraviolet Coverage
Descrição: The Hubble UltraDeep Field has deep observations at Far-UV, optical (B-z), and NIR wavelengths, but only comparatively shallow near-UV (u-band) from WFPC2. We propose to complete the UDF coverage with deep near-ultraviolet imaging with the WFC3-UVIS in the F225W, F275W, F336W. We will reach point source limits of ABmag=29, a factor of ten fainter than the GALEX ultradeep surveys. Our dataset will add to the value of the UDF legacy, and requires the unique capabilities of HST. In the spirit of the UDF, we submit this proposal in the Treasury category. We will provide science quality images and photometric catalogs to enable a range of research topics by the community. The science goals of the team are to investigate the episode of strong star formation activity in galaxies at 1Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Duilia Fernandes de Mello - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Space Telescope Science Institute - Auxílio financeiro.
2009 - 2012
Interacting galaxies and their environments
Descrição: The aim of this program is to investigate the environmental effects in galaxy properties, in particular in the tidal tails and bridges of interacting galaxies. These low density regions are unique laboratories where star formation is unexpectedly common and possibly driven by collisions between turbulent gas clouds. This mode of star formation is not well understood, but, while inefficient in an overall sense, appears quite capable of producing relatively normal stars and star clusters. Whether these are distributed with normal upper IMFs, however, remains to be settled, e.g. extended FUV emission in low density systems could be due to an overproduction of intermediate relative to high mass stars. Studies of the properties of the stellar populations in low density regions are essential for understanding this issue..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Duilia Fernandes de Mello - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): NASA - Auxílio financeiro.

Apoios financeiros recebidos:
2012 : US$25,244 - Project: Cosmic Assembly Near-Infrared Deep Extragalactic Legacy Survey (STScI/HST)
 2011 : US$96,800 - Projects: The Panchromatic Hubble Ultra Deep Field: Ultraviolet Coverage (STScI/HST) + Stellar Disks with Herschel (Sub-contract STScI in collaboration with Klaus Pontoppidan - Sandra Blevins)
 2010 : US$37,000 - Project: First Resolved Imaging of Escaping Lyman Continuum (STScI/HST)
 2009: US$208,111 - Project: Interacting Galaxies and Their Environments NASA/Astrophysics Data Program
 2008: US$210, 000 - Projects: M82 a Template in the Local and Distant Universe with HST - Predictions for JWST (STScI/HST) + Stars Outside Galaxies with Swift (NASA) + NASA/GSRP grant Bridging the Gap in Galaxy Evolution + First Resolved Imaging of Escaping Lyman Continuum (STScI/HST)
 2007: US$180,000 - Projects: M82 a Template in the Local and Distant Universe (STScI/HST) + Multiwavelength views of galaxy evolution (NASA) + First Resolved Imaging
of Escaping Lyman Continuum (STScI/HST)
 2006: US$139,000 - Projects: Physical Properties of SINGS galaxies (Spitzer) + A High Resolution Alpha-enhanced Stellar Library for Evolutionary Population Synthesis (STScI/HST) + Star Formation in HI Debris with GALEX Star Formation Activity in Compact Groups of Galaxies (GALEX)
 2005: US$90,000 - Projects: Ultraviolet Imaging of the Ultra Deep Field (STScI/HST) + UV properties of Moderate Redshift Galaxies as a Function of HST Morphology (GALEX) + GOODS WFPC2 parallels (STScI/HST) 
 2003: US$150,000 - Project: GOODS WFPC2 parallels (STScI/HST)
 2000{2002: 1.360M SEK - Projects: Star formation in primordial galaxies. (The Swedish Research Council) + From Local Starbursts to the High-z Universe (Swedish Space Board) (1 US$  6.8 SEK)
 1999{2000: 138,000 SEK - Gender balance program award at Chalmers University
